questions.question: To drive a vehicle ecologically, it is recommended;

options.text: To use engine braking to slow down
To disengage the gear during braking
To use both, the service brake and hand brake for quick and efficient braking.

questions.question: Ecological driving of a vehicle means:

options.text: Not to pollute the environment by using the music system at maximum power
To always maintain the vehicle clean by washing and degreasing daily
To be calm and to anticipate situations, so as to avoid sudden acceleration and braking.

questions.question: For the purposes of eco-driving a car, it is recommended:

options.text: To avoid the unnecessary transport of objects in the trunk or passenger compartment
Not to have the extra luggage trunk permanently mounted on the vehicle
To use spoilers and additional lights.

questions.question: What does it mean to drive a car ecologically?

options.text: The obligation to always use biodegradable fuel
To make urban trips by bike, on foot or by any means that does not pollute the environment
A set of behavioral measures, to check the vehicle, which results in saving energy and protecting the environment.

questions.question: Driving a vehicle ecologically means:

options.text: Planning the route to save time and fuel
Avoiding areas with dense traffic, works on roads or damaged terrain
High speed acceleration to shorten travel time.

questions.question: To drive a car ecologically, it is recommended:

options.text: Idling the engine, if you stay longer in the same place
Maintaining a constant speed, preferably medium
Stopping the engine while driving downhill, to save fuel.

questions.question: When is it recommended to switch off the engine, to reduce fuel consumption?

options.text: In case of long stops at railway level crossings
At red traffic lights, in places where it usually last very long
At the signal of the traffic policeman.

questions.question: To drive a vehicle ecologically you must:

options.text: Check the tyre pressure once a month, when the tyres cold
Interchange the tyres, about every 10,000 km
Replace tyres every 1,000 km.

questions.question: Is it advisable to keep or stow certain objects on the floor of the car?

options.text: Yes, as long as they do not hinder driving
Yes, if there is no other place to put small objects
No, because these objects can roll and reach under the pedals and create dangerous situations.

questions.question: What should you consider when moving along a row of parked vehicles?

options.text: A door can be opened at any time by the occupants of vehicles
Maintain the speed limit because drivers are required to do so
Horn to warn other drivers that you move in the area.

questions.question: What should you expect when, in front of you, a bus has stopped at a bus station?

options.text: An intersection follows, as most stations are located in such places
It is possible that some passengers alight and cross in front of the bus, without properly ensuring
On leaving the station, the bus can change its direction to the left, without ensuring.

questions.question: Some children cross the street playing with a ball. How is it recommended to behave?

options.text: Reduce speed as the behavior of children can be unpredictable
Proceed without restrictions, the children will get onto the sidewalk
Accelerate to leave the area as soon as possible.

questions.question: You are driving a car with a trailer, on a road which has one lane for each direction. You approach a very tight curve to the left, with no visibility. How do you adapt your driving?

options.text: Reduce speed before the curve as there is an increased danger of the trailer skidding
Reduce speed, drive towards the middle of the lane and accelerate slightly when you reach the peak of the curve
Maintain speed and brake in the curve.

questions.question: You intend to move after having parked on the road. Behind you a car is parking. What are the dangers in this situation?

options.text: No dangers
Oncoming vehicles can notice you late
Due to reduced visibility, vehicles at the rear can see your vehicle signaling late.

questions.question: What is recommended at night, in terms of preventive behavior, for a beginner?

options.text: To have the battery in good condition
To avoid, if possible traveling on a long route that includes driving on high traffic roads
To carry reflective triangles and replacement bulbs to ensure the headlights function at all times.

questions.question: What do you do if you notice an elderly person wrongly crossing the public road in front of you?

options.text: Signal using the horn and lights to stop the person from crossing
Reduce speed in time and take all measures to avoid hitting the person crossing the road
You have no legal obligations. In case of an accident, the imprudent pedestrian will answer for any damages caused.

questions.question: How is it recommended to behave in this situation?

options.text: Stop only if the ball stops on the road
Reduce speed and prepare to stop
Continue to drive, because children are not allowed to enter the roadway.

questions.question: In terms of preventive behavior, what can you expect in this situation?

options.text: The cyclist will stop
The cyclist can change the direction of travel to the left without ensuring or signaling
The cyclist will behave correctly.

questions.question: What will you do at night when visibility is reduced due to fog, from the point of view of preventive driving?

options.text: Drive closer to the axis of the road
Drive closer to the right edge of the road
Keep an equal distance between the road axis and the right edge of the road, at a speed that allows stopping in a space smaller than the space in vision.

questions.question: What is the role of head restraints in terms of preventive behavior?

options.text: In case of an impact at the rear of the vehicle, it prevents a likely fracture of the cervical spine
Has only an aesthetic role
Helps in fixing phones, allowing calls without having to place the device at the ear.

questions.question: Preventive driving ensures:

options.text: Maintaining the technical condition of the vehicle
Safety and going with the flow of traffic on public roads
Prolonging the life of the engine.

questions.question: What to do in case you see a ball rolling in front of you?

options.text: Continue to drive at the same speed as a ball rolling in front is not dangerous for the vehicle
Sound the horn, reduce speed and drive with maximum attention as it is very possible a child might run after the ball
Turn abruptly in the opposite direction of the rolling ball.

questions.question: What is meant by vigilance in terms of preventive behavior?

options.text: The ability not to conflict with police
To be rested and well fed, not to be forced to stop on the route
Keep the attention uninterrupted throughout the driving.

questions.question: What is meant by preventive driving in bad weather?

options.text: To comply strictly with the speed limits on the road
To reduce speed to make sure you have good visibility and command full and control
To drive as close as possible to the axis of the road.

questions.question: Which of the following factors is the basis of preventive behavior?

options.text: Knowledge of traffic rules and regulations
Ability to be polite and disciplined in traffic
Maintaining the weight of the vehicle within standards specified.

questions.question: How will you proceed on a curve with low visibility, when you encounter a cyclist in front of you?

options.text: Reduce speed and drive behind the cyclist until the road offers good visibility for overtaking
Horn to attract the attention of the cyclist, for you overtake
Continue driving because in such situations you are allowed to overtake cyclists.

questions.question: How do you proceed when, driving behind a cyclist he wants to change the direction of travel?

options.text: You horn to signal your intention to overtake
You provide conditions that allow him make his maneuver
You have no obligation, because it is a very slow vehicle.

questions.question: In which of the following situations is a driver required to use low beam?

options.text: In case of poorly lit roads, when visibility is reduced, both in localities and outside them
When stationing (parking) at night on national roads or when parking in unlit areas and zones
On national roads, during the day, in situations where traffic is congested.

questions.question: The main cause leading to accidents is the lack of attention during driving. How is this avoided?

options.text: By alternating alertness with relaxed driving, especially on straight road sections
By staying focused at all times on activities that ensure driving safely
By listing to music at full blast, to stay alert during driving.

questions.question: What do you understand by preventive driving in adverse weather conditions?

options.text: Drive at a speed lesser than the legal maximum allowed on the section of road
Drive carefully at a speed that allows you to stop safely and avoid any danger
Use the high beam and warning (blinking) lights to be seen more easily.

questions.question: What are your obligations at the indicator cyclists?

options.text: To reduce speed and drive at a maximum of 30 km/h
Drive carefully and give priority to cyclists crossing at specially designed tracks
You do not have any obligation, cyclists will give you priority.

questions.question: In terms of preventive behavior, how do you handle this situation?

options.text: Reduce speed, because a child may return to take the ball from the street
Maintain speed as children were warned to stay safely on the sidewalk
Increase speed, because children do not run on the street.

questions.question: When are the rules of preventive driving applied?

options.text: When actually driving the car on public roads
When the vehicle is stopped in traffic
Both, when driving and when the vehicle is stopped.

questions.question: What is meant by preventive behavior?

options.text: A valid concept for beginners leaning to drive
Road behavior that prevents accidents by anticipating and avoiding improper actions of others on the road, and adapting speed to weather-specific road conditions
The quality of drivers to drive cautiously at low speeds so as not to inconvenience other road users on public roads.
